description.narrative: Born in 1989, in the continuity of the autonomous feminist movement, which imposed itself in Tunisia in the face of a "state feminism" which took the rights of women hostage and exploited them in the service of a hegemonic, tutelary regime and undemocratic. The ATFD has always been the bearer of a vision, which is that of a modern and democratic Tunisia, which respects equality between women and men, human dignity, freedom, secularism and social justice; a Tunisia where all forms of discrimination and violence against women would be abolished. Following this vision, the mission of the association is to fight for the promotion and defense of women's rights in laws and practices and against all forms of violence and discrimination against them as well as the dissemination of the culture of women. gender equality at all levels: social, economic, political, cultural and legal ATFD works for The elimination of all forms of discrimination against women. The defense of acquired rights and the evolution of Tunisian legislation with a view to effective equality between the sexes. The transformation of patriarchal mentalities. Women take charge of their problems and fight in solidarity with a view to non-discriminatory solutions. The participation of women incivil and political life. The unrestricted recognition of their citizenship penalty Our founding principles: women's rights: are interdependent, indivisible and inalienable human rights based on gender equality, freedom and human dignity. are an integral part of the struggle for real democracy and social justice,both in the public and private spheres. Framework for action: Adoption of a feminist approach and action for the promotion of women's rights, for the fight against discrimination and for solidarity, through general and specific commissions, regional spaces and sections, particularly: The Listening and Guidance Center for Women Victims of Violence. Ilhem Marzouki Feminist University The Safia Farhat Documentation Center The sections of Sousse, Sfax, Kairouan and Bizerte.

participating-org.narrative: ATFD, Tunisian Association for Democratic Women is a women rights NGO founded in 1989. The organization has now 3 regional affiliates with limited autonomy and one central office in Tunis. ATFD is funded by various international donors (UN Women, OSI...)and is very active in advocacy human rights and women rights. Previously criticized for its elitism, ATFD is now expanding its work on outreach in rural areas. ATFD is known for its counselling centers for women victims of violence, its advocacy for lifting reservations onCEDAW and for leading various women rights coalitions and initiatives.
